wikipedia_page.main: Anne Rudge (29 October 1761 – 1 September 1836) was a British botanical illustrator who illustrated the works of her husband, the botanist Edward Rudge and her son, the barrister and antiquary Edward John Rudge, among others. She is one of the earliest known published female botanical artists, as, unlike many other female artists in her field at that time, she signed her work.
